ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I do not think this instructors teaching the course again. The course in general is a straightforward continuation of the previous semester quantum mechanics and will cover more applications.

Excellent course to hone your quantum mechanics skills, focusing on time dependent QM and scattering theory. Not too work intensive, though (open-notes) exams can be difficult due to the lack of practice solving problems.

Definitely -- you learn more in-depth quantum mechanics, mostly time-dependent QM, and I found that I gained a much more intuitive understanding of QM. Tully was awesome, but unfortunately I think this is the last year he's teaching.
I would recommend it to students who already have a very solid background.
Even without any background you can understand this course

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Let me know about all the things I need more experience in... Got me introduced to the fundamentals of physical chemistry.
I get to know the most important topics in quantum mechanics. But one needs to work hard to understand the details.
It helped me learn a lot abt the chemistry
